Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw and label two different land habitats, marking a garden and a forest with varying levels of detail.
The student can draw and label two water habitats, such as a pond and a stream, although there might be minor inconsistencies in labeling.
The student can include drawings of various plants like trees and bushes in land habitats and aquatic plants in water habitats, although occasionally not all plant types are shown.
The student can include drawings of different animals in each habitat, showing lizards and squirrels in the garden or forest and fish in the pond or stream.
The student can generally demonstrate how living things exist in different places on land and in water, with clear visual distinctions.
CANNOT: The student might struggle to show consistent patterns between the land and water habitats, occasionally mixing some elements (e.g., showing a land animal in water habitats).
The student might incompletely label some aspects of the drawing, like forgetting to label or mislabeling certain plants or animals they drew.
